page.title: 18FOOT_PATHS _ CLEE HILL AREA
page.content: There are many foot_paths in the area. Most of them are near the villages of{Clee Hill}and{Hope Bagot. Some of them go across the common, while others go through woodlands, such as{Gorstley Rough}and{The Novers. Recently some of them have been marked with yellow arrows and sign posts, and stiles have been renewed. To keep them open, these paths have to be walked once a year, but after 5 years, if no one has walked them, they can be closed. If a foot_path crosses your land, you are to make sure it is kept clear. Walkers are not supposed to wander off from the path. There are also bridle paths along which you can ride horses. In summer it is pleasant to go for walks, but in the winter, the paths are covered in leaves and branches, and it is usually muddy.
